title: How to Build an Auto Chicken Farm in Minecraft

steps.title: Place the chest on the ground.
steps.content: Place the chest on the ground. You'll need to be able to access this chest when your automatic farm is complete in order to get your cooked chicken.

steps.title: Place a hopper feeding into the chest.
steps.content: Place a hopper feeding into the chest. Put the hopper in the space right behind your chest so your inanimate objects can move to it (you may need to press Shift while you click to be able to change the direction the hopper is moving. The Shift + Click command allows you to place blocks on active blocks without opening them). The hopper will allow the cooked chicken to automatically drop into the chest.

steps.title: Place a building block behind the hopper.
steps.content: Place a building block behind the hopper. You now have a 1x3 grid.

steps.title: Place 2 dispensers on top of the building block facing the chest.
steps.content: Place 2 dispensers on top of the building block facing the chest. This layer is 3 blocks deep so far. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Place a slab on your hopper.
steps.content: Place a slab on your hopper. This block is only half the thickness of a normal block so it can collect items on top of the slab. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Place a hopper behind the first layer of dispenser.
steps.content: Place a hopper behind the first layer of dispenser. The space below the newly placed hopper is empty for now. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Place a carpet over the hopper.
steps.content: Place a carpet over the hopper. The carpet will prevent the chickens from moving or falling through the hopper. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Place a building block behind the hopper, on the first layer.
steps.content: Place a building block behind the hopper, on the first layer. Since the first layer under the hopper is empty, the block will also be on the first layer.

steps.title: Place a comparator on top of the building block you just put down.
steps.content: Place a comparator on top of the building block you just put down. This doesn't look like it will take up the full block space, but the blank area above it is considered this block. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Place an observer on top of the comparator.
steps.content: Place an observer on top of the comparator. You now have an empty block between your comparator and the top dispenser on the other column. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Add glass blocks to either side of the carpet.
steps.content: Add glass blocks to either side of the carpet. The observer and dispenser blocks are covering the front and back of the carpet, so you need to add two blocks of glass to either side of the carpet. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Cover the rest of the area with building blocks.
steps.content: Cover the rest of the area with building blocks. Encase the rest of the building with building blocks, but make sure to leave the center block blank so you can put chickens inside it. Start off with two chickens and let them breed until you get 24 chickens.

steps.title: Close the top with another observer block and destroy the top layer of building blocks.
steps.content: Close the top with another observer block and destroy the top layer of building blocks. Once you have 24 chickens, place an observer block facing your chest and use an axe to destroy your building blocks. [8] X Research source You should have your 24 chickens in that empty block space with an observer block on top, two glass blocks around the outside, and a dispenser and hopper in front and behind.

steps.title: Place redstone dust on the blocks in front and behind the observer block and destroy the rest of your excess building blocks.
steps.content: Place redstone dust on the blocks in front and behind the observer block and destroy the rest of your excess building blocks. This includes the building block next to your dispenser and hopper to the ground level.

steps.title: Add glass blocks two-layers high around the hopper.
steps.content: Add glass blocks two-layers high around the hopper. Make sure you're leaving the area above the hopper empty.

steps.title: Add a lava bucket to the dispenser.
steps.content: Add a lava bucket to the dispenser. Click the dispenser to interact with it and pull up a 3x3 grid. Put the lava in the middle of the grid. [9] X Research source Any eggs your chickens lay will move into the bottom dispenser, which will move them to the other open space where adult chickens will encounter the lava. Those adult chickens will create cooked meat that will drop onto the slab, which will move into your chest via the lowest hopper.
